messages.title: Austerity is hardest on women and families
messages.content: We've had seven years of Tory austerity, seven years during which they have worked hard to dismantle the parts of our society that treat and care for the sick, support people with benefits and training, help our children to succeed and see us all through when we need help. Instead, they have cut taxes for the rich and done nothing to chase tax avoiders. Women have borne the brunt of austerity. We need a Labour government now to make Britain a fair, safe and caring country once more.

messages.title: Vote Labour for a better Britain
Our schools, NHS and social care services are at breaking point under the Tories.
messages.content: Many people are struggling to keep their homes while the rich get tax breaks. Vote Labour on 8 June for a country run for the many, not the few.

messages.title: Why I am backing Bill Edwards
messages.content: I will vote for Labour in the general election because I believe in a society that places its priorities in justice, equality and compassion for the weak and vulnerable.

messages.title: Our NHS is buckling under a sustained Tory attack
messages.content: The NHS is at breaking point under the Tories - waiting lists have soared to 3.8 million and it's harder to see your GP. Nurses' pay has fallen by 14 per cent since 2010. Services rely on staff from Europe - the Tories' hard Brexit may send them all home. Labour will give the NHS the money it needs.

messages.title: Ordinary people can't afford a place to live
messages.content: The Tories can't fix Britain's housing crisis - since 2010 housebuilding has fallen to its lowest peacetime level since the 1920s. Rents are astronomical and "affordable" housing isn't affordable for most people. Labour will build one million new homes, 50 per cent of them for social letting.

messages.title: Our education system risks breaking apart
messages.content: The Tories are the party of the few not the many - they are the party of Eton and grammars for the few, and of inadequate funding and collapsing school buildings for the many. Labour will make sure all children get the chance to succeed, by funding education fairly and equally.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Defend the NHS and social care services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will give the NHS and social care services the money they need.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Every child the chance to succeed
keyPolicies.policyDescription: No new grammar schools for the few, provide all schools the money they need to give good education for all.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect wages and create good jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: An end to exploitation through zero-hours contracts and a real Living Wage of £10 an hour.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Affordable homes to rent and buy
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will build one million new homes for Britons, half for rent; we'll scrap letting fees for private renters.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A co-operative relationship with Europe after Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will ensure that EU citizens already here can stay, and that we'll get good deals on trade, justice, science and travel.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour will ensure that EU citizens already here can stay, and that we'll get good deals on trade, justice, science and travel.
